comments.name: Lars
comments.comment: BTW: I'm on Debian 6 and keeping the -b option in doesn't seem to make any problems. I only had to remove the -daemon option. Even after restart of the Machine Jetty starts. I used: update-rc.d jetty defaults to register the script.

comments.name: Sindre
comments.comment: Thank you. You saved me many hours of debugging :). I only removed the --daemon option and it seem to work. I haven't tried rebooting yet though.

comments.name: Scott Diedrick
comments.comment: Thanks for this post. I ran into the same problem on Ubuntu 10

comments.name: Pankaj
comments.comment: Thanks man, for listing out the whole procedure. Though, in my case the error wasn't occuring because of -daemon but because of wrong permissions for the log directory. But I was only able to discover it because of your article.

comments.name: jd
comments.comment: Another thank you! for the clear and step-by-step description. Not assuming/skipping info was very helpful. I had exactly the same problem.

comments.name: David Smiley
comments.comment: This is exactly what I needed; thanks!
